<@UCD4Z3NJZ> <@UC6SUUPRC>  Scary code and jokes aside:stuck_out_tongue:

I was looking at an alternative way to display a simple image instantaneously and most lightly...

I think, the solution I came to, is
1. Find an external and light open source image viewing software, make it into an artifact using BinaryBuilder, then use `popen` via ccall to load the images
2. QML.jl is broken(atleast for me), and GTK.jl is too bulky. The lightest and instantaneous route here is ModernGL.jl + CImGui.jl. 
Edit: After taking time to implement option 2, its just as slow.... I think it'd be better if I write something in C and then just crosscompile it using BinaryBuilder......
